jsx.http.rpc
Class XMLHttpRemote.Caller

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.http.rpc.HttpRemote.Context
              jsx.http.rpc.XMLHttpContext
                  jsx.http.rpc.XMLHttpClient
                      jsx.http.rpc.XMLHttpRemote.Caller
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnHTTPLoaded
Enclosing class:
XMLHttpRemote
public abstract class XMLHttpRemote.Caller
extends XMLHttpClient
implements OnHTTPLoaded

Client-side XML & HTTP serialization contexts for asynchronous connections.

A XMLHttpRemote.Caller is also an event listener that handles HTTPLoaded events fired from its underlying Ajax connection.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Constructor Detail

XMLHttpRemote.Caller

protected XMLHttpRemote.Caller(java.lang.String url)

A typical constructor which invokes the typical constructor of the superclass without arguments, creates an Ajax connection and then listens the connection for HTTPLoaded events.

Parameters:
url - A HTTP resource locator of the connection.
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

callback

protected abstract void callback(java.lang.Object ret)

Calls back with a return value.

The subclasses implements this method to get return value from the asynchronous call connection.

Parameters:
ret - The return value.
Since:
1.0

call

public final void call(ArrayLike<?> args)

Initiates an asynchronous call through the connection with the specified arguments.

Parameters:
args - An array of arguments.
Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(HTTPLoaded evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method retrieves the XML response, updates the calling context and calls callback(Object) with the return value.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnHTTPLoaded
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0
